DOCNAME: CASE OF ALFATLI AND OTHERS v. TURKEY (as regards the applicant Mahmut Memduh Uyan)
CONCLUSION: Violation of Art. 6-1 with regard to the length of the proceedings;Violation of Art. 6-1 concerning independence and impartiality of the court;Pecuniary damage - claim dismissed;Non-pecuniary damage - financial award;Costs and expenses partial award
TEXT: CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was arrested and placed in police custody . He was accused of membership of an illegal organisation , the Dev - Yol ( NORP Way ) . On DATE ORG ( PERSON ) ordered the applicant 's detention on remand .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG filed a bill of indictment with ORG setting out charges against CARDINAL defendants , including the applicant . The military prosecutor accused the applicant of membership of an organisation whose aim was to undermine the constitutional order and replace it with a NORP - Leninist regime , contrary to Articles CARDINAL § CARDINAL and CARDINAL § CARDINAL of LAW .
CARDINAL . After martial law was lifted , ORG took the name of ORG attached to ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG convicted the applicant and sentenced him to death penalty . The applicant appealed against the conviction and the case was referred to ORG ( PERSON ) .

CARDINAL . Following promulgation of the PERSON of DATE , which abolished the jurisdiction of the martial law courts , ORG ( Yargıtay ) acquired jurisdiction over the cases and the files were sent to it .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was released pending trial .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld the applicant 's conviction .
CARDINAL . A description of the relevant domestic law and practice can be found in Şahiner v. GPE , judgment of DATE , Reports of Judgments and Decisions CARDINAL .
CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL of the Code of Criminal Procedure lists the circumstances in which “ a person convicted in a judgment that has become final may be granted a retrial ” .
It was amended by LAW no . DATE , which added a sixth set of circumstances in which the proceedings could be reopened :

“ where it has been held in a final judgment of ORG that a decision in criminal proceedings was given in breach of ORG or its Protocols . In such cases , an application to reopen the proceedings may be lodged within DATE of the date on which the judgment of ORG became final . ”

Law no . DATE came into force on DATE . By provisional section CARDINAL of the LAW , section CARDINAL is applicable in CARDINAL sets of circumstances : where the ORG has delivered a judgment that became final before the PERSON came into force , and where the ORG delivers a final judgment on an application lodged after the PERSON came into force .
